fields.name: Fatigue
fields.title: Fatigue
fields.description:
Q1 I felt tired.
0 – 100 (0 “Not at all” 100 “Very much”)

fields.description:
Q2 I felt sad.
0 – 100 (0 “Not at all” 100 “Very much”)

fields.description:
Q3 I felt lonely.
0 – 100 (0 “Not at all” 100 “Very much”)

fields.name: Concentrat

fields.description:
Q4 I had trouble concentrating.
0 – 100 (0 “Not at all” 100 “Very much”)

fields.name: LossOfInt
fields.title: Loss of interest
fields.description:
Q5 I had little interest in doing anything.
0 – 100 (0 “Not at all” 100 “Very much”)

fields.name: Inferior

fields.description:
Q6 I felt inferior to others.
0 – 100 (0 “Not at all” 100 “Very much”)

fields.name: Hopeless
fields.title: Hopeless
fields.description:
Q7 I felt pessimistic about my future.
0 – 100 (0 “Not at all” 100 “Very much”)

fields.name: Stress
fields.title: Stress
fields.description:
Q8 I felt stressed (tense, restless, nervous or anxious).
0 – 100 (0 “Not at all” 100 “Very much”)

fields.name: PSMU
fields.title: Passive social media use
fields.description:
Q10 I engaged in passive social media use.
0 – 100 (0 “Not at all” 100 “Very often”)

fields.name: AutoPSMU
fields.title: Automatic passive social media use
fields.description:
Q9 I started passive social media use before I realized I was doing it.
0 – 100 (0 “Not at all” 100 “Very often”)

fields.name: News
fields.title: News
fields.description:
Q11 While on social media, I received news about politics, public events and public issues.
0 – 100 (0 “Not at all” 100 “Very often”)

fields.name: Active
fields.title: Active social media use
fields.description:
Q12 I actively used social media by commenting, posting, sharing or chatting.
0 – 100 (0 “Not at all” 100 “Very often”)

name: socialmedia-depression
title: Social Media and Depression Symptoms
description:
This Data Package contains the raw data for the following publication: 

Aalbers, G., McNally, R. J., Heeren, A., De Wit, S., & Fried, E. I. (2019). Social media and depression symptoms: A network perspective. Journal of Experimental Psychology: General, 148(8), 1454. http://dx.doi.org/10.1037/xge0000528

The raw data can be found at the Open Science Framework: https://osf.io/czs6y/
